intro: Licania teixeirae, commonly known as the Teixeira's licania, is a species of flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, simple leaves, and showy yellow flowers with five petals. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
